title: Connecting Through Art
summary: Free creative arts program for people living with Parkinson’s and their families.
description: Join us for a free creative arts session led by Dr. Rongyi Sun. Participants will create abstract art in a welcoming and supportive environment. Open to people living with Parkinson’s, care partners, children, and grandchildren. No prior art experience required.

title: Grief Support Group for Neurological Disease Loss
summary: Biweekly online support group for those who have lost a loved one to a chronic neurological illness. Open to Columbia caregivers.
description: This biweekly group offers support for those grieving the loss of a loved one to a brain cancer or chronic neurological disease like ALS or Parkinson’s. Sessions cover grief-related topics and ways to honor their memory. Participants must commit to at least 6 of 9 sessions.

requirements: Caregivers of those who had a chronic neurological disease treated at Columbia

registration.note: Registration is required. A social worker will contact you after submission.

facilitators: Nicole Ross, LMSW, OSW-C – Neuro-Oncology Social Worker
Linda Golding, MA, BCC – Multifaith Chaplain

title: Speech for PD
summary: Free, online speech classes for people with Parkinson’s and their care partners, led by Dr. Gemma Moya-Galé at Columbia University.
description: Speech for PD is a university- and community-based program offering free online group speech classes to improve communication and social connection for people with Parkinson’s disease. Founded by Dr. Gemma Moya-Galé in 2019 and supported by the Parkinson’s Foundation.

contact.name: Dr. Gemma Moya-Galé
contact.title: PhD, CCC-SLP, Teachers College, Columbia University

values: Speech for PD is an inclusive and diverse community that empowers people with PD and promotes social connection.
goals: Our goal is to improve quality of life through voice strengthening and social communication in a supportive space.

title: CUIMC Parkinson's Support Group
summary: Providing educational information and support to individuals with Parkinson’s disease and their families. During every transition and challenge in your journey of living with Parkinson’s disease, knowing that you are not alone is important.

registration.note: Meetings are held via Zoom. Registration is required to receive the meeting link, ID, and password.

title: Parkinson's Care Partners Support Group
summary: Monthly support group dedicated to care partners of people living with Parkinson’s disease.
description: A supportive space for care partners to connect, share experiences, and receive guidance. This group is exclusively for care partners and meets monthly.

title: More than Medicine Informational Session
summary: Quarterly informational session about advanced Parkinson’s treatment options, including DBS.
description: Formerly known as the DBS Informational Session, this program provides education on advanced treatment options for Parkinson’s disease. Open to anyone interested in learning more.

title: Access to Care Orientation
summary: Monthly orientation covering transportation, Medicaid, advance care planning, and more.
description: Learn about transportation resources, Medicaid enrollment, advance care planning, homecare eligibility, work accommodations, SSD/SSI, and additional support services for people living with Parkinson’s and care partners.

title: Deep Brain Stimulation Support Group
summary: Monthly support group for individuals who have undergone DBS surgery and their care partners.
description: A support group for people living with Parkinson’s who have already had Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS) surgery and their care partners. Provides a space to share experiences and receive peer support.

title: Caregivers Support Group (Sephardic Community Center)
summary: Monthly caregiver support group hosted in partnership with the Sephardic Community Center.
description: Support group for care partners of individuals living with Parkinson’s disease. Meets monthly in partnership with the Sephardic Community Center.

title: Parkinson’s Disease Support Group (Senior Helpers NYC)
summary: Monthly Parkinson’s support group hosted in partnership with Senior Helpers NYC.
description: Support group for people living with Parkinson’s and their care partners, held in partnership with Senior Helpers NYC.
